thread.title: Top college athletes set to compete in Landfall Tradition
thread.title_full: Top college athletes set to compete in Landfall Tradition

author: Stacey Pinno
title: Top college athletes set to compete in Landfall Tradition
text:
Top college athletes set to compete in Landfall Tradition Posted: 2015 Landfall Tradition takes place this weekend. (Source: Free Stock Photos) WILMINGTON, NC (WECT) - 
Dozens of the country’s top female college athletes will be in the Port City this week to participate in the Landfall Tradition Golf Tournament. The UNCW Lady Seahawks will be hosting the tournament for the 14th year in a row. 
The Landfall Tradition is a three-day tournament held on the County Club of Landfall Dye Course. 
A practice round will get underway Thursday around 7:30 a.m., followed by the dinner of champions that evening, and tournament play will start early Friday morning. 
The 18 teams from 11 states, representing 9 conferences will include; UNCW Seahawks, North Carolina, North Carolina State, Wake Forest, South Carolina, and Virginia. 
The Big Ten Conference has four representatives in Michigan State, Ohio State, Penn State, and Purdue. 
Rounding out the field are Notre Dame, Central Florida, Oklahoma State, Alabama, Clemson, and first timers Elon, and Kentucky. 
Wake Forest will be defending their championship title. The Demon Deacons have won the tournament a total of three times. 
Money raised from the golf tournament goes to the UNCW golf scholarship fund. According to the Country Club of Landfall’s website , since the tournaments inception in 2002, the Landfall Tradition has raised more than $1 million for the UNCW golf program. 
The program, however, isn’t the only one that gets a boost. Each year the tradition generates a positive economic impact to the Wilmington area of approximately $250,000. 
Tournament play will begin at 8:00 a.m on Friday. Admission and parking are free and open to the public.
